2.title: Find Black-owned bookstores near you
2.subtitle: The African American Literature Book Club (AALBC.com) has put together a map of Blac-owned bookstores across the US. Find your nearest one here.

3.title: Text a bot for book suggestions
3.subtitle: Twitter user @ecmoy created a bot that you can text for recommendations of books written by Black authors based on genre. It will also link you to a Black-owned bookstore that is selling the title. Text (409) 404-0403 to try it!

3.title: The New Jim Crow
3.subtitle: The New Jim Crow is a stunning account of the rebirth of a caste-like system in the United States, one that has resulted in millions of African Americans locked behind bars and then relegated to a permanent second-class status—denied the very rights supposedly won in the Civil Rights Movement.

4.title: Just Mercy: A Story of Justice and Redemption
4.subtitle: An unforgettable true story about the potential for mercy to redeem us, and a clarion call to end mass incarceration in America — from one of the most inspiring lawyers of our time.

4.title: Justice for Julius Jones
4.subtitle: Julius Jones is on death row in Oklahoma, despite maintaining his innocence and compelling evidence that he was wrongfully convicted. Send an email to express your support of his release.

emailInfo.subject: Justice for Julius Jones
emailInfo.messageBody:
Dear Oklahoma Pardon & Parole Board members,

I strongly feel that Julius Darius Jones (# 270147) was wrongfully convicted of murder and sentenced to death in 2002. A crime for which he has always maintained his innocence.

Jones, a black 19 year old man, was arrested in 1999 for shooting white insurance executive Paul Scott Howell in Edmond, Oklahoma. At the time of his arrest, Julius was a successful athlete and honor student on scholarship at the University of Oklahoma.

Recently, new evidence of racial bias in the Jones’ case has been uncovered by the ABC documentary, “The Last Defense.”

One day after the documentary finale aired (7-25-18), the Oklahoma Criminal Court of Appeals released a document indicating they could take a look at the Jones’ case.

There are many factors that were overlooked and never presented during the Julius Jones trial.
1. Jones’ attorney during the trial was inexperienced by his own admission and this was his first death penalty case.
2. Several key pieces of evidence were never presented to the jury.
3. Tunnel vision set in and the police and prosecutor ignored evidence pointing to others as the shooter.
4. The court ignored an alleged racial statement made by one of the jurors
5. The jury judged Jones based on his race.
After viewing the recent ABC documentary, “The Last Defense,” I am even more convinced than ever of Julius’ innocence and that he should be given a new trial. I also ask that District Attorney David Prater release Julius Jones’ case files to his attorneys in order to promote public trust in both the criminal justice system and in Julius Jones’s case.

We all have all heard the phrase ‘beyond a shadow of doubt.’ To me, there is more than a shadow of doubt in this case.

Please, I ask that you do whatever is within your power to support Julius Jones’ Clemency Petition and see that this injustice – the wrongful conviction of Julius Jones – is overturned.

Thank you,
[Your Name]
[Your location]

5.title: 360 Magazine
5.subtitle:
360 is an edgy fashion, lifestyle and culture magazine. We will introduce cutting-edge brands, entities and trends to tastemakers within their respective communities. Our founding members have over 30 years of collective experience both as notable talent and uber professionals within the realm of fashion, music, art, design and entertainment. We are more than just a magazine comprised of journalists, representing a movement of social awareness and change.

We are a LGBTQIA friendly publication. The magazine is contemporary in look and appeal. Quality art content is the constant goal. The magazine will be entertaining, newsworthy and thought-provoking. It will appeal to a broad entertainment readership. No magazine like it is available today, constantly celebrating racial and sexual ambiguous talent and artists.

5.title: Gifts for the Spirit
5.subtitle: An independently run, spiritually driven, boutique for the soul

products.name: Melanated Classic Tarot
products.description: Various races and nationalities practice tarot for healing and education, but it's hard to heal and learn with tools that don't represent you. This deck is a solution to that problem.

products.name: Bel Meditation Candle Set
products.description: The BEL uses fire, gravity, and sound to measure time. When the candle is lit, wax melts and eventually a pin falls, landing with a resonant ding - a beautiful way to end your meditation.

products.name: Small Garnierite Palm Stone
products.description: Known as the stone of the Goddess Gaia, GARNIERITE (also called Green Moonstone), is a rare form of Moonstone used for emotional healing, balance, and freedom.

6.title: Harriet Tubman - Biography
6.subtitle: Harriet Tubman was an escaped enslaved woman who became a "conductor" on the Underground Railroad, leading enslaved people to freedom before the Civil War, all while carrying a bounty on her head. But she was also a nurse, a Union spy and a women’s suffrage supporter.

9.title: Code Switch Podcast
9.subtitle: Hosted by journalists of color, our podcast tackles the subject of race head-on. We explore how it impacts every part of society — from politics and pop culture to history, sports and everything in between. This podcast makes ALL OF US part of the conversation — because we're all part of the story.

11.title: Netflix Explained: Racial Wealth Gap
11.subtitle: Cory Booker and others discuss how slavery, housing discrimination and centuries of inequality have compounded to create a racial wealth gap.

11.title: How the Dodgers 'Took' Jackie Robinson | Field of Dreams...Deferred Part 3
11.subtitle: Brooklyn Dodgers executive Branch Rickey signed Jackie Robinson from the Kansas City Monarchs in 1945, but he refused to pay Negro League teams for their players. Watch more on the fight to integrate MLB in "Field of Dreams...Deferred" Part 3.

12.subtitle: Stay clean, fresh, and balanced, even during your period with our natural menstrual products. Banish bacteria and cramps with herbal-infused, chemical-free sanitary pads and tampons that create a "cooling" effect that’s both protective and soothing.

products.name: Menstrual Cup

products.name: Mommy-to-Be Wash

products.name: Soothing Body Balm
products.description: This body salve is infused with natural magnesium for menstrual cramps and 500 mg of broad-spectrum hemp distillate. This hemp and magnesium body balm does not contain THC.

12.title: Dynamic Confluence
12.subtitle: I have items that I carry with me anywhere I go in case of an emergency. I couldn't find an emergency kit that was complete, so I made a few of my own. I hope people will find these items useful. It's better to have and not need, than need and not have.

13.title: The Collective PAC
13.subtitle: The Collective is strengthening our democracy by addressing the significant underrepresentation of the Black community in public office. We are fighting for equal representation and protection under the law so it is vital that we have Black candidates run, and Black voices heard.

13.title: Free Minds Book Club
13.subtitle: Change lives today. Donate now to support incarcerated and formerly incarcerated youths and adults.

15.title: What it takes to be racially literate
15.subtitle: Over the last year, Priya Vulchi and Winona Guo traveled to all 50 US states, collecting personal stories about race and intersectionality. Now they're on a mission to equip every American with the tools to understand, navigate and improve a world structured by racial division.

15.title: AllGoudes & Services
15.subtitle: Whether you have a college degree and are seeking to make your first steps onto your career path, or just looking to secure steady income by obtaining an entry level position; AllGoudes and Services makes sure that you’ll be ALLGOUDE in your job search! It’s your time! Let us help you display your worth to potential employers.

16.title: Negro League Baseball
16.subtitle: Negro League Baseball got its start thanks to the increasing popularity of two things after the Civil War: baseball and segregation.

16.title: Reopen Sandra Bland's Case
16.subtitle: Sandra Bland was arrested for a traffic stop on July 10, 2015 by Brian Encinia.  She was found dead in her cell three days later. Encinia was never indicted, in spite of the fact, that he physically assaulted her her on camera. There is a new video that has come to light, which may have been hidden from the grand jury.

17.title: Shades of My Melanin LLC
17.subtitle: At Shades of My Melanin, our goal is to not only offer products that make you feel beautiful in your own skin but to offer products that tell a story for each and every person who wears them. We offer fun, colorful, and creative products that can be worn by all ages.

17.title: How we can make racism a solvable problem — and improve policing
17.subtitle: When we define racism as behaviors instead of feelings, we can measure it — and transform it from an impossible problem into a solvable one, says justice scientist Dr. Phillip Atiba Goff. In an actionable talk, he shares his work at the Center for Policing Equity, an organization that helps police departments diagnose and track racial gaps in policing in order to eliminate them.

18.title: Designs by Tee LLC
18.subtitle: Brooklyn Social Worker designing positive t-shirts and apparel. Supporting homeless children and families in NYC.

18.title: Whistling Vivaldi
18.subtitle: Claude M. Steele, who has been called "one of the few great social psychologists," offers a vivid first-person account of the research that supports his groundbreaking conclusions on stereotypes and identity.

19.title: Racial Literacy: A Call to Action for Teachers
19.subtitle: Uprisings in the wake of George Floyd’s death at the hands of police and the worldwide reaction demanding racial justice represented a wake-up moment for schools. Talking about race will be essential if we are going to serve all students well.

19.title: Intersectionality Matters! Podcast
19.subtitle: Intersectionality Matters! is a podcast hosted by Kimberlé Crenshaw, an American civil rights advocate and a leading scholar of critical race theory.

20.title: Open a random campaign to donate to
20.subtitle: Take the effort of decision out of it — tap here and we'll select a random campaign for you to support!
20.info: Update to the latest version of the app to get access to this feature

20.title: How to overcome our biases? Walk boldly toward them
20.subtitle: Our biases can be dangerous, even deadly — as we've seen in the cases of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri, and Eric Garner, in Staten Island, New York. Diversity advocate Vernā Myers looks closely at some of the subconscious attitudes we hold toward out-groups. She makes a plea to all people: Acknowledge your biases.

21.title: The Sentencing Project
21.subtitle: The Sentencing Project promotes effective and humane responses to crime that minimize imprisonment and criminalization of youth and adults by promoting racial, ethnic, economic, and gender justice.

21.title: Scent Affairs
21.subtitle: Our goal is to continuously strive to make and provide a quality product. The goal, create a safe, effective, quality product with a long lasting scentual affect.

22.title: Beauty Bakerie
22.subtitle: A single mother and breast cancer survivor, Cashmere Nicole founded Beauty Bakerie in 2011 as a new lipstick brand that was vegan, non-toxic and cruelty-free.

products.name: Chocolate Therapy Sugar Sticks
products.description: A castor oil infused lip liner collection that delivers high-quality custom coverage while lining & defining your lip look. Just add 1/2 cup of sugar and everything will be pretty sweet!

products.name: Frozen Mini So Icy Illuminator
products.description: Our So Icy loose powder illuminators will give your cheeks #thatSNOWglow from iridescent, crushed-pearl pigment with high payoff. Best applied with a brush (but go ahead, dip your fingers in!)

products.name: Blending Egg Beauty Sponges
products.description: Cooked up with you in mind, Blending Egg Beauty Sponges were uniquely created to fit in the palm of your hand for seamless blending. Try a recipe with a dash or two of Cake Face Concealer and bake until your heart's content with Flour Setting Powder. Blending Eggs will be your new favorite tool for eggs-traordinary cakin' that's hard to beat! Hehe.

22.title: An interview with the founders of Black Lives Matter
22.subtitle: In this spirited conversation with Mia Birdsong, the movement's three founders share what they've learned about leadership and what provides them with hope and inspiration in the face of painful realities. Their advice on how to participate in ensuring freedom for everybody: join something, start something and "sharpen each other, so that we all can rise."

23.title: Beyond the Numbers: The Experiential Effects of Stereotype Threat on Students of Color at TCU
23.subtitle: This study aims to examine if and how the effects of negative stereotypes of students of color are felt beyond the statistical measures of academic success, reaching into the classroom and social experiences of these students.

23.title: Support the Milwaukee Freedom Fund
23.subtitle: The Milwaukee Freedom Fund is extending support to protestors in Kenosha, WI. Their mission is to build on ongoing bail abolition efforts, support immigration efforts, work towards Black and Brown Liberation, and support Black and Brown young people as they build a new world.

24.title: TGEU International Women’s Day - Inclusivity Media Statement
24.subtitle: On the occasion of the International Women’s Day (IWD) on 8 March, TGEU joins the voices of trans people around the world in denouncing oppression, violence, and hate against women and non-binary people in all spheres of life.

24.title: How to Be an Antiracist
24.subtitle: Ibram X. Kendi's concept of antiracism reenergizes and reshapes the conversation about racial justice in America—but even more fundamentally, points us toward liberating new ways of thinking about ourselves and each other.

25.title: Esusu
25.subtitle: Forbes Under 30 social entrepreneurs, Nigerian-born entrepreneur Wemimo and his business partner Goel co-founded Esusu in 2019. The mobile platform helps individuals mostly from marginalized communities save money, access capital and build credit.

25.title: Martin Luther King Jr.’s ‘Letter From Birmingham Jail’
25.subtitle: In April 1963, King was jailed in Birmingham, Alabama. While there, he wrote a lengthy letter in the margins of a newspaper, and smuggled it out with the help of his lawyer. The eloquent call for “constructive, nonviolent tension” to force an end to unjust laws became a landmark document of the civil-rights movement.

26.title: Color blind or color brave?
26.subtitle: The subject of race can be very touchy. As finance executive Mellody Hobson says, it's a "conversational third rail." But, she says, that's exactly why we need to start talking about it. In this engaging, persuasive talk, Hobson makes the case that speaking openly about race — and particularly about diversity in hiring — makes for better businesses and a better society.

26.title: Change.org: Justice for Daunte Wright
26.subtitle: 20 year old man Daunte Wright, a father to a two year old, was murdered by Minneapolis-area police. Help get him and his family justice by signing this petition.

27.title: Daunte Wright was stopped for expired plates, but driving while Black may have been his 'crime'
27.subtitle: The police confrontation escalated after officers saw what could have been an air freshener hanging illegally from the rearview mirror.

27.title: Ban or Restrict Tear Gas
27.subtitle: The use of tear gas has been banned and is illegal in war. This same tear gas is used by the law enforcement, to control unarmed crowds protesting for the BLM movement. Tear gas is also used for border control and is thrown at innocent migrants who are unarmed and pose no sudden threat to anyone in the vicinity.

28.title: My Beautiful Fluff
28.subtitle: Clothes designed with curves in mind. Each shirt is cut to accommodate curves and fluff with custom to cut to my size chart with sizes L to 5XL.

29.title: Classify White Supremacist Groups as Domestic Terrorist Organizations
29.subtitle: Request a new legal requirement to register, classify, and subsequently surveil white supremacist organizations as domestic terrorist organizations. By classifying these groups as intimidating to the American population and dangerous to human life, the institutions responsible for protecting citizens against such groups will have the necessary information and resources to prevent further destruction carried out by these violent terrorist groups.

30.title: A Content Analysis and Study of Colorism and Strides toward Inclusivity in the Cosmetic Industry
30.subtitle: The purpose of this research is twofold: 1) to explore colorism in the cosmetic industry in light of multiple marketing venues such as social media, online, and retail stores and 2) to provide a snapshot of improvement (or lack of) in shades and foundation colors offered in the beauty industry.
